Package moulton.scalable.popups

Class NotificationPopup

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.popups.Popup
      • moulton.scalable.popups.NotificationPopup
  • public class NotificationPopup
extends Popup
    This is an example of what can be done with popups. Sometimes the user needs to be notified of some event or information before they proceed to the next action, and this popup fulfills this purpose. Admittedly its design does not allow for much flexibility: the constructor calls an init method that creates the contents of the popup on its base panel.
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

    • Constructor Detail

      • NotificationPopup

        public NotificationPopup​(java.lang.String text,
                         java.lang.String okId,
                         java.lang.String title,
                         java.awt.Font font,
                         boolean exitButton)
        Parameters:
        text - the text that is the notification
        okId - the ID that should be used for the accept and exit buttons. *This ID should be used to remove the popup from the MenuManager (MenuManager.setPopup(Popup)) as an event in MenuManager.clickableAction(Clickable) for this popup to function properly.*
        title - the title of the popup. Set to null for no title.
        font - the font of the text on the popup.
        exitButton - whether an x button in the top right corner should be included in the popup.

      • NotificationPopup

        public NotificationPopup​(java.lang.String text,
                         java.lang.String okId,
                         java.lang.String title,
                         java.awt.Font font,
                         java.lang.String x,
                         java.lang.String y,
                         boolean exitButton)
        Parameters:
        text - the text that is the notification
        okId - the ID that should be used for the accept and exit buttons. *This ID should be used to remove the popup from the MenuManager (MenuManager.setPopup(Popup)) as an event in MenuManager.clickableAction(Clickable) for this popup to function properly.*
        title - the title of the popup. Set to null for no title.
        font - the font of the text on the popup.
        x - the x location of the popup
        y - the y location of the popup
        exitButton - whether an x button in the top right corner should be included in the popup.

    • Method Detail

      • findNaturalBreak

        protected int findNaturalBreak​(java.lang.String text,
                               int startIndex,
                               int breakFrom)
        Finds a natural word break in the given string text. The search for the break index starts at the index specified by breakFrom then continues going backwards at most to the startIndex.
        Parameters:
        text - the text that needs to be broken
        startIndex - the earliest index that breaks could appropriately be found at
        breakFrom - the index where the search for breaks should start
        Returns:
        the index found where the text should break. If no break character is located within the proper boundaries, breakFrom is returned.
